docs.snippet: Google, Privacy And California     After I wrote about Google's spat with an advertising trade group over the company's refusal to put a link to its privacy policy on the home page of Google.com, I discovered that there is a California law on the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Google, Privacy And California After I wrote about Google's spat with an advertising trade group over the company's refusal to put a link to its privacy policy on the home page of Google.com, I discovered that there is a California law on the subject. It requires the operator of a commercial Web site that collects personal information about users to ''conspicuously post its privacy policy'' on its home page or first ''significant'' page after entering the site.

headline.main: Google, Privacy And California

docs.abstract: Google's posting of its privacy policy, which is one click away from its home page, is in dispute in California because state law requires computer sites to post policy on its home page of first 'significant' page after entering site (M)

headline.main: The Hidden Danger of Gmail Labs

docs.abstract: Google has introduced GMail Labs, where its employees can experiment with useful and silly tweaks to its popular e-mail program. It illustrates what is becoming a new truism of Silicon Valley: A community of developers can enrich software with creativity, fun and all sorts of utility. But it is virtually impossible for a mob to keep it simple.

docs.lead_paragraph: Google's massive reservoir of data about online behavior, gathered by tracking hundreds of millions of computers, is like the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge. It is a resource that might or might not be exploited safely, and there certainly should be a robust debate before the drilling starts.

headline.main: Google Tests Using Your Search Data to Tailor Ads to You

docs.snippet: Yahoo Answers solicits replies - from everyone - to any and all questions....
docs.lead_paragraph: You're not supposed to use the Internet like a Magic 8 Ball. Google can't tell you whether you'll pass the bar exam or find happiness in Spokane. But almost from the start, the Web has been barraged with personal questions - often highly subjective ones. Internet users want to do more than "conduct searches" as if they were military police. They want to canvass opinions, plead for sympathy, share an experience or otherwise be humored.

docs.snippet: Carl C. Icahn has been uncharacteristically mum on whether he plans to proceed with his proxy battle with Yahoo management, but the Internet search giant's top brass has apparently decided to try to cut him off at the pass.     In a new letter to ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn has been uncharacteristically mum on whether he plans to proceed with his proxy battle with Yahoo management, but the Internet search giant's top brass has apparently decided to try to cut him off at the pass. In a new letter to its shareholders -- once again explaining why a search advertising deal with Google is superior to Microsoft's offer to buy its search business -- Yahoo's chief executive, Jerry Yang, and its chairman, Roy Bostock, slammed Mr. Icahn's attempt to install a rival slate, calling Mr. Icahn's agenda ''narrow.''

headline.main: Icahn's Silence

docs.abstract: Carl Icahn has been uncharacteristically silent on whether he plans to proceed with proxy battle with Yahoo management; Yahoo chief executive Jerry Yang and chairman Roy Bostock, in letter to shareholders, slam Icahn's attempt to install rival slate; photo

byline.original: By ANDREW ROSS SORKIN and MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

docs.snippet: Did Google use its network of online services to silence critics of Barack Obama?...
docs.lead_paragraph: One of our sib-blogs, Bits, has a post up about some anti-Obama bloggers who wonder whether Google was manipulated by activists seeking to silence them.

headline.main: Google and the Anti-Obama Bloggers

docs.abstract: Did Google use its network of online services to silence critics of Barack Obama?

docs.snippet: Google freezes, then unfreezes, a number of anti-Obama blogs, saying it was a mistake caused by e-mail spam....
docs.lead_paragraph: (UPDATE 7:20 p.m.| Added comment from one of the bloggers who was shut down by Google.)

headline.main: Google and the Anti-Obama Bloggers

docs.abstract: Google freezes, then unfreezes, a number of anti-Obama blogs, saying it was a mistake caused by e-mail spam.

docs.snippet: Seth MacFarlane, the creator of the Fox animated sitcom "Family Guy," is developing a new series that will appear exclusively on the Internet....
docs.lead_paragraph: Seth MacFarlane, the creator of the Fox animated sitcom "Family Guy," is developing a new series that will appear exclusively on the Internet, Brooks Barnes reports. "Google will syndicate the program using its AdSense advertising system to thousands of Web sites that are predetermined to be gathering spots for Mr. MacFarlane's target audience, typically young men." Read more...

headline.main: 'Family Guy' Creator's Internet Bet

docs.abstract: Seth MacFarlane, the creator of the Fox animated sitcom "Family Guy," is developing a new series that will appear exclusively on the Internet.

docs.snippet: Google will syndicate a new animation series using its AdSense advertising system to Web sites that are predetermined to be gathering spots for the show’s target audience....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google will syndicate a new animation series using its AdSense advertising system to Web sites that are predetermined to be gathering spots for the show’s target audience.

headline.main: Google and Creator of ‘Family Guy’ Strike a Deal
headline.print_headline: Google and Creator of ‘Family Guy’ Strike a Deal

docs.snippet: Google Services On Your TV     Google has entered the living room, but it's not clear whether it is just wandering through or whether it will grab some popcorn, plop on the couch and stay for a while....
docs.lead_paragraph: Google Services On Your TV Google has entered the living room, but it's not clear whether it is just wandering through or whether it will grab some popcorn, plop on the couch and stay for a while.

headline.main: Google Services On Your TV

docs.abstract: Google has introduced new feature to its Google Desktop program that can help move content from Internet onto television; service is called Google Media Server; photo (M)
